title: Soma Magazine headline type
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071030200939im_/http:/typophile.com/files/SNC13148_5917.JPG)

 [‹ spunge](http://web.archive.org/web/20071030200939/http:/typophile.com/node/38472 "Go to previous forum topic") [clandestino serif ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071030200939/http:/typophile.com/node/38462 "Go to next forum topic")
author: coupdegrace

comments.content:
The Italic seems to be Caslon No 540 Italic and swash letters.

Stefan

A bit of kerning in F ashion wouldn’t go amiss.

Nick Cooke
H eart is not bad either.

\>It’s LTC Caslon.

It’s not.  
Maybe the swash letters, don’t know..

Its Caslon No 540.  
The a, f and above all the e differs (its much better an elegant in 540!)  
the right top bowl (an example) of the e is much smaller than the one on the left. (not so in LTC version)  
Also the a is straight at the end of the line on the top right.

Compare your scan to the screenshot that I made from the LTC Link!  
Look also the f...

Stefan

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071030200939im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Bild-1_4477.gif)

Besides,

the 540 is the most elegant Caslon cut ever. Very nice for use in fashion!

Stef

[http://image.linotype.com/samples/hirespdf/12727.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20071030200939/http:/image.linotype.com/samples/hirespdf/12727.pdf "http://image.linotype.com/samples/hirespdf/12727.pdf")
